intro: Sauropus macranthus, commonly known as the large-leaved sauropus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
